intro: Rinorea belizensis, commonly known as the Belize rinorea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
